metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2848 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
ISC BIND 9.1.0 through 9.8.4-P2 and 9.9.0 through 9.9.2-P2 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (assertion failure and daemon exit) via malformed options data in an OPT resource record.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2848` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.9').
